meanings.definition: The act of valuing or considering something important or worthy.
meanings.sent1: Her worthing of family always comes first in her decisions.
meanings.sent2: His worthing of honesty made him return the lost wallet.
meanings.sent3: The cat's worthing of the new toy was evident by how protective it was of it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's worthing of education shone through in every lesson.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's worthing of bravery inspired the whole team.

meanings.definition: The process of deserving or meriting something.
meanings.sent1: His hard work led to his worthing of a promotion at work.
meanings.sent2: The student's dedication to studying earned her worthing of the scholarship.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's worthing of treats was evident by its wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's worthing of a gold medal was the result of years of training.
meanings.sent5: The singer's worthing of applause was clear from the audience's enthusiastic cheers.

meanings.definition: The act of estimating the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler's worthing of the diamond was based on its clarity and cut.
meanings.sent2: Her worthing of the antique vase was higher after learning about its history.
meanings.sent3: The child's worthing of the toy was evident by how carefully he played with it.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent's worthing of the house was influenced by its location and size.
meanings.sent5: The chef's worthing of the ingredients determined the quality of the dish.
